page.title: 11TALKING TO OUR VICAR
page.content: We went to the Rectory in Cheveley where Reverand Davis lives. He is the Rector of St Mary's CofE Church. He told us about his job and what he does in his spare time. He does things like gardening, embroidery and reading. He works as a full time priest, going to meetings and visiting the ill in hospital. He also christens, marries and buries people as well as running the normal church services. Mr Davis's wife runs the Climbers' Club-a group something like Sunday School. We asked him why he chose to be a vicar. He said,"I didn't, but something inside me made me do it." He has been at Cheveley for 2\years. The church is being repaired at the moment. One of the stained glass windows, the tower, and one of the walls are being repaired. The cost will be about Â£57,000.
